author: THE NEWS HERALD sports@pcnh.com
title: Blountstown shuts down Freeport
text: Blountstown shuts down Freeport Blountstown kept pace in District 3-1A by winning its seventh consecutive game of the season as Tristen Burke scored four touchdowns in a 42-0 win over Freeport on Friday night. Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 12:29 AM Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 12:29 AM FREEPORT — Blountstown kept pace in District 3-1A by winning its seventh consecutive game of the season as Tristen Burke scored four touchdowns in a 42-0 win over Freeport on Friday night. The Tigers, 7-1 overall and 3-0 in the district, moved within one week of a showdown with defending state champion Port St. Joe for district bragging rights. Freeport dropped to 4-3, 0-2. Blountstown scored on five of its six possessions in the first half. The first touchdown came early for the Tigers with quarterback Chasen Roulhac connecting with Tristen Burke on a 5-yard pass play to cap a 60-yard drive. Derek Eberly booted the first of his six extra points for a 7-0 margin with less than 4 minutes elapsed. Blountstown scored again with Roulhac hitting Burke on a 34-yard pass play, and opened a 21-0 lead in the first quarter when Burke scored his third TD on a 27-yard run. Roulhac was 10 of 11 passing for 163 yards and connected with Burke again for 29 yards to make it 28-0. Just before halftime Roulhac added a 6-yard scoring run and the Tigers led 35-0 at intermission. The entire second half was played with a running clock. Blountstown added one more touchdown on Cole Skipper’s 1-yard run. Burke had 55 yards on six carries for the Tigers and six receptions for 109 yards. Chris Decker topped Freeport with 39 yards in 13 carries. The Bulldogs were held to 36 total yards and only two first downs. Ayers Hassig topped Blountstown with 11 tackles, Tracy Carillo had seven and Stephen Mathews and Trevon Mathews six each. By THE NEWS HERALD
